Academics Home / Explore Programs / Biomedical Engineering

Biomedical Engineering

Degree

Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Engineering

School

Engineering

Department

Biomedical Engineering

Program at a Glance

Our ABET-accredited program focuses on core engineering principles to understand and model human body system function, control, treatment, and integration. Fundamental design principles are integrated throughout the curriculum, emphasizing medical devices and design control regulations.

ApplyRequest Info

Programs of Study

Bachelor’s degree

Biomedical Engineering, BSBME

Dual degrees

Biomedical Engineering, BSBME/MD (Doctor of Medicine)
TCNJ School of Engineering, New Jersey Medical School

Biomedical Engineering, BSBME/ME
Biomedical Engineering, BSBME/MS
TCNJ School of Engineering, Rutgers University

Students benefit from:

  • Outstanding placement record… students often actively sought out by employers and graduate programs.
  • Summer internships
  • Students learn in state-of-the-art laboratories and gain hands-on experience with advanced engineering software and equipment.
  • Small class sizes foster direct interaction with core faculty in an interdisciplinary environment that allows students to engage with peers and faculty across various STEM disciplines.
  • In lab and field settings, students collaborate on faculty-mentored research teams.

Careers

Students prepare for careers as biomedical engineers in industry, in various healthcare settings such as hospitals and medical research facilities or to pursue graduate studies in biomedical engineering. Biomedical engineering is also an excellent preparation for medical school.

Biomedical Engineering Research Track

The Biomedical Engineering Research Track is designed for exceptional students to pursue a faculty-mentored research experience for 2-4 consecutive semesters at 0.5 or 1.0 course units per semester. Participation for one summer is required, contingent on a successful MUSE faculty-student application. The student will receive 2-course units that apply to two of the 4 BME electives.

State-of-the-art Facilities

At TCNJ, students have access and exposure to cutting-edge equipment and dedicated specialty laboratories. Hands-on lab classes empower the application of skills and the confirmation of theoretical principles learned in the classroom. Recent multimillion-dollar investments ensure students learn in modern facilities with advanced instrumentation and state-of-the-art tools for design, prototyping, and validation.

Faculty

Our faculty members are expert researchers and educators who are committed to mentoring capable, inquisitive, well-equipped engineers and teachers. Faculty eagerly share their energy and enthusiasm for research and innovation, opening research projects to students and engaging in high mentoring. With deep engagement in their respective engineering fields, faculty members design their curricula to create pathways to professional competency and opportunity.
